column5: Config Reference

column6:
Checks whether skill proficiency tracking is configured for Skill Assessments when role skills are enabled in Career Hub.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, tracking employee proficiency in role-related skills during assessments will not function, reducing upskilling effectiveness.
column8: Skill Assessments v2 with role skills enabled

column6:
Checks whether Skill Assessments are configured on the employee profile page, enabling direct access for employees to complete assessments aligned with role skills.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees will not see Skill Assessments on their profiles, reducing participation and tracking.
column8: Skill Assessments v2 with role skills enabled

column6:
Checks whether skill proficiency configurations are enabled for Skill Assessments within Career Hub, ensuring proper tracking of skill assessment behaviors.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, skill proficiency tracking during assessments will not function, impacting employee skill profiling and progress tracking.

Checks whether Skill Assessments are configured within the profile page layout, enabling employees to access and complete assessments directly from their profile.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, employees will not see or access Skill Assessments from their profile, limiting skill tracking and upskilling workflows.

Checks whether access checks for Skill Assessments are enabled in Career Hub, allowing controlled access to assessment workflows.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, skill assessments may not respect access rules, leading to inconsistent user experience.

Checks whether access checks for Skill Assessments are enabled when role skills are configured, ensuring assessments respect access control and role-based workflows.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, assessments may bypass access control, leading to inconsistencies in who can access skill assessments.
column8: Skill Assessments v2 with role skills enabled
column11:
Checks whether access checks for Skill Assessments are enabled when role skills are configured, ensuring assessments respect access control and role-based workflows.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, assessments may bypass access control, leading to role skills not appearing

column6:
Checks whether employee engagement tracking is enabled in Career Hub when using Skill Assessments with role skills, allowing for monitoring and improvement of employee participation in upskilling workflows.

Impact of Failure
If not enabled, engagement tracking will not function, reducing visibility into employee participation in skill development.
column8: Skill Assessments v2 with role skills enabled
column11:
Checks whether employee engagement tracking is enabled in Career Hub when using Skill Assessments with role skills, allowing for monitoring and improvement of employee participation in skill development.

Impact of Failure
If not enabled, engagement tracking will not function, reducing visibility into employee participation in skill development.

column3: Upskilling tab exists under own profile page
column6:
Checks whether the Upskilling tab is configured to appear under the employee's own profile page, enabling employees to view and manage upskilling plans within Career Hub.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees will not see the Upskilling tab, reducing visibility into upskilling opportunities.

Checks whether at least 75% of employee profiles have at least one skill added, ensuring profiles are enriched for recommendations and skill-based workflows.

Impact of Failure
Insufficient skills on profiles will reduce the effectiveness of recommendations and insights across Talent Management modules.
column10: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)

column6:
Ensures the filter list for recommended jobs in Career Hub is configured. This feed shows jobs personalized for the employee based on their profile and preferences.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees may receive irrelevant job recommendations, reducing engagement with the Career Hub.
column10: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)

column6:
Ensures the filter list for similar people recommendations in Career Hub is configured. This feature shows employees other people with similar current or target titles for networking and exploration.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees may see irrelevant recommendations or fail to see potential peers, reducing the utility of Career Hub.
column10: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)

column3: Career Hub Home Page Card Configuration
column5:
Home page feature cards may be disabled. Go to integrations/career_hub_base_config::product_configs>employee'>Career Hub Base Config and verify:
1. In 'home_page_config' > 'cards', enable desired feature cards
2. For Mentors: ensure 'recommended_mentors' card is enabled
3. For Courses: ensure 'recommended_courses' card is enabled
4. For Career Navigator: ensure 'career_navigator_tour' card is enabled
5. Check card display order and personalization settings
column6:
Ensures that key Career Hub feature cards are enabled and visible on the employee home page, including Mentors, Courses, Career Navigator Tour, and other discovery features.

Impact of Failure
Important Career Hub features are not visible to employees on their home page, reducing feature discoverability and adoption.
column10: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)

column6:
Checks whether employee engagement features are enabled in Career Hub to track and encourage participation in upskilling and career development workflows.

Impact of Failure
If not enabled, employee engagement tracking and related workflows will not function, reducing visibility into participation.
column10: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
column11:
Checks whether employee engagement features are enabled in Career Hub to track and encourage participation in upskilling/development plan workflows.

Impact of Failure
If not enabled, employee engagement tracking and related workflows will not function, reducing visibility into participation.

column6:
Ensures that employee hiring bands are set up and linked to the correct seniority levels in the calibration settings. This helps align employees and roles by level, enabling accurate search, recommendations, and analytics.

Impact of Failure
Missing or incorrect bands can lead to mismatched job recommendations, broken filters, and inaccurate seniority-based indexing.
column10: Core Talent Management (Employee Profiles and Career Hub homepage)
column11:
Ensures that employee hiring bands are set up and linked to the correct seniority levels in the calibration settings. This aligns employees and roles by level, enabling accurate search, recommendations, and analytics.

Impact of Failure
Missing or incorrect bands can lead to mismatched job recommendations, broken filters, inaccurate seniority-based indexing, and will also affect mentorship recommendations if hiring bands are not configured.

column6:
Checks whether courses have skills tied to them, which is essential for filtering and recommending courses in the upskilling plan workflow.

Impact of Failure
Courses without associated skills cannot be recommended accurately, reducing the effectiveness of upskilling recommendations.

Ensures the "My Courses" section is available in the Career Hub navigation bar, providing employees with access to assigned, in-progress, and completed courses in one place.

Impact of Failure
If missing, employees may struggle to track learning progress or locate relevant courses, reducing participation in development initiatives.

Ensures the "Courses Explore" feature is enabled, allowing employees to browse and search for courses using various filters to discover learning opportunities aligned with their goals.

Impact of Failure
If not enabled, employees may struggle to find relevant courses, reducing participation in learning initiatives.

Ensures courses are integrated into Global Search, allowing employees to find relevant courses alongside other entities within the platform.

Impact of Failure
If not enabled, employees may find it difficult to search for courses, reducing participation in development programs.

Tracks the percentage of courses with associated skills, ensuring course suggestions for upskilling plans are relevant and skills-based.

Impact of Failure
Low skill mapping reduces the effectiveness of course recommendations for upskilling plans.
column11:
Tracks the percentage of courses with associated skills, ensuring course suggestions for upskilling plans, career navigator paths & course recommendations are relevant and skills-based.

Impact of Failure
Low skill mapping reduces the effectiveness of course recommendations across TM

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have level
column6:
Checks if most employees have a level defined in their profile, which is essential for seniority inference and accurate role initialization in Career Navigator.

Impact of Failure
Missing employee levels can break matching, reduce recommendation quality, and disrupt seniority-based workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have their associated levels defined in Internal mobility config
column6:
Checks if employee levels are defined in the Internal Mobility configuration, which is critical for role hierarchy and accurate matching in Career Navigator.

Impact of Failure
Missing level configurations can lead to incorrect eligibility calculations and limit internal mobility workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have job code
column6:
Checks whether employees have job codes defined in their profiles. Job codes are critical in Talent Management for succession planning, Career Navigator, and linking employees to roles. They also help auto-initialize roles based on employee count.

Impact of Failure
If job codes are missing, role mapping and initialization may fail, affecting downstream workflows like succession tracking and internal mobility visibility.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have level
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a level defined in their profiles. Levels are used to infer employee seniority and help auto-initialize roles with the appropriate seniority for planning and mobility workflows.

Impact of Failure
Missing level data affects seniority inference, which can break key features like matching, recommendations, and role creation logic.

Checks whether most employees have a Business Unit (BU) defined in their profiles. This field is essential for organizational grouping, permissioning, analytics, and segmentation in Talent Management workflows.

Impact of Failure
Missing Business Unit values can lead to misaligned access permissions, broken analytics, and ineffective organizational grouping in the platform.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of positions should have hiring_band
column6:
Checks whether most positions have a hiring band defined. Hiring bands are critical for enabling job recommendations within the eligible band range, based on the employee's level.

Impact of Failure
Missing hiring band data prevents accurate job recommendations and breaks band-based eligibility logic in Career Hub workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have location
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a location defined in their profile. Employee location is essential for accurate job recommendations, geo-based insights, and experience personalization.

Impact of Failure
Missing location data limits personalized experiences, reduces relevance of job recommendations, and may affect location-based reporting and permissions.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have hiring_date
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a hiring date defined in their profile. Hiring date is essential for tenure calculations, workforce analysis, and insights related to attrition and experience.

Impact of Failure
Missing hiring dates can impact employee tenure analytics, reduce accuracy of workforce reports, and affect downstream features such as retention tracking.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have seniority level
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a seniority level derived from their current title. Seniority is essential for talent management workflows, influencing job recommendations, benchmarking, and succession planning.

Impact of Failure
Missing seniority levels can lead to inaccurate matching, ineffective internal mobility recommendations, and breakdowns in career pathing logic.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have lob (Line of Business)
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a defined division (Line of Business). Division data is crucial for understanding employee roles and for auto-initializing role business functions in career and mobility workflows.

Impact of Failure
Missing division (LOB) values may result in inaccurate role mapping and broken logic for career pathing, recommendations, and workforce planning.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have job code
column6:
Checks whether most roles have a job code defined. Job codes uniquely identify roles and enable Talent Management products to map employees to the correct roles and support accurate succession, pipeline, and mobility workflows.

Impact of Failure
Missing job codes for roles can break employee-role mapping, reduce matching accuracy, and affect downstream processes that rely on role uniqueness.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have titles
column6:
Checks whether most roles have titles defined. Titles are critical for all roles as they drive recommendations and support matching in Talent Management modules like Career Navigator.

Impact of Failure
Missing role titles can break job matching, reduce recommendation quality, and impact visibility in career planning workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have an associated level
column6:
Checks whether most roles have an associated level defined. Levels help determine role seniority and hierarchy, supporting accurate recommendations and career pathing in Talent Management modules like Career Navigator.

Impact of Failure
Missing role levels can break seniority inference, reduce the effectiveness of matching and recommendations, and affect career planning workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have their associated levels defined in Internal mobility config
column6:
Checks whether most roles have their associated levels defined in the Internal Mobility configuration. This setup is critical for understanding role hierarchy and supporting eligibility, matching, and internal mobility workflows.

Impact of Failure
Missing role levels in the configuration can lead to incorrect eligibility checks, poor matching, and breakdowns in career planning workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have business function
column6:
Checks whether most roles have a business function defined. Business functions help determine the domain of a role and influence job recommendations and matching in Career Navigator and other Talent Management modules.

Impact of Failure
Missing business function data can reduce the quality of recommendations, affect domain-based matching, and break role grouping in career planning workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of projects should have skills
column6:
Checks whether most projects have skills tagged. Associating skills with projects helps showcase employee capabilities, supports accurate skill mapping, and improves internal mobility and development planning.

Impact of Failure
Projects without skills reduce the platform's ability to infer employee capabilities, impacting skill-based recommendations and visibility in internal searches.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager email
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a manager email defined. Manager emails are used to determine reporting structure, support org chart visualization, and enable permission controls based on managerial hierarchy.

Impact of Failure
If manager emails are missing, org charts may be incomplete, and manager-based workflows or permissions may not function as intended.
column11: Checks that most employees have their manager's email address. Manager emails are needed to show who reports to whom, create org charts, and control access based on management levels. Impact of Failure Without manager emails, org charts will be incomplete, manager-based features won't work properly, and skills assessments (which require manager assessment) will be incomplete.

column6:
Checks whether most employees have a valid manager email assigned. A valid manager email must match the email of an existing employee profile. This is required to build accurate org charts and enforce permission rules based on managerial relationships.

Impact of Failure
If manager emails are missing or invalid, org charts may be incomplete, and features relying on manager-based permissions (like approvals and insights) may not function correctly.
column12: Rule checks for the presence of an email. Absence of an email is treated as invalid. True email validity check would be checking for email domain name.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should not be thin profiles
column6:
Tracks the percentage of employees who do not have a thin profile. Ensuring complete employee profiles is important for accurate matching, recommendations, and workforce insights.

Impact of Failure
A high percentage of thin profiles limits the effectiveness of Talent Management features, reduces the quality of recommendations, and impacts analytics and reporting accuracy.
column11: The rule can be stated positively instead of negation. Eg: At least 95% of employees should have enriched profiles Rich employee profiles are essential for accurate job matching, high-quality recommendations, and meaningful workforce insights. Impact of Failure When too many employees have basic profiles with minimal information, Talent Management features become less effective, recommendations lose quality, and analytics become less accurate and useful. This metric passes when at least 95% of employees have enriched profiles.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have skills
column6:
Checks whether most courses have skills tagged. Skills are essential for delivering accurate course recommendations, enabling skill-based learning paths, and improving the relevance of suggestions within Talent Management workflows.

Impact of Failure
Courses without skills cannot be recommended effectively, reducing the quality of learning paths and personalized suggestions for employees.
column12: The rule does not specifically track for presense of skills. This should be added.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have title
column6:
Checks whether most courses have a title defined. Course titles are essential for identifying content, improving discoverability, and inferring skills that employees can learn from the course.

Impact of Failure
Courses without titles are difficult to identify and cannot be used effectively for recommendations, reducing engagement with learning resources.
column12: The rule may not be working as expected. Even if course.title is present, the rule flags as fail.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have relevant (50+ words) description
column6:
Checks whether most courses have a relevant description of at least 50 words. Course descriptions help employees understand course content and are used to infer skills associated with the course for recommendations.

Impact of Failure
Courses without sufficient descriptions are harder to discover, reduce learner engagement, and limit the platform's ability to map skills for personalized recommendations.
column12: The rule may not be working as expected. Even if course.description is present, the rule flags as fail.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of projects should have title
column6:
Checks whether most projects have a title defined. Project titles are important for identifying and showcasing work, enabling discoverability and supporting career development conversations.

Impact of Failure
Projects without titles are harder to identify, reducing their visibility within employee profiles and limiting their use in growth and development planning.
column11:
Checks whether most projects have a title defined. Project titles are important for identifying and showcasing work, enabling discoverability and supporting career development conversations.

Impact of Failure
Projects without titles are harder to identify, reducing their visibility within employee profiles and limiting their use in growth and development planning.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of projects should have description
column6:
Checks whether most projects have a description provided. Project descriptions add context to employees' work, making it easier to showcase contributions and align them with skill development and career goals.

Impact of Failure
Projects without descriptions provide limited value in profiles, reducing visibility in internal searches and weakening career development insights.
column12: Passing Rule needs to be reviewed. I found a rule that said 26 out of 64 had description. But the passing rule had 0 projects.

column6:
Checks that the redirect URL configuration for job applications in Internal Mobility is set. If apply_through_api is not supported by the ATS, the system should redirect employees using apply_url_template or apply_url_config.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees may face issues applying to jobs, leading to application failures and frustration.
column10: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)

column3: Careerhub employee max resume size bytes
column6:
Ensures the maximum allowed resume upload size for job applications in Career Hub is configured. Setting this value prevents upload errors, enabling a smooth application experience for employees.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, users may encounter errors when uploading large resumes, leading to frustration and potential drop-offs during the application process.
column10: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)

column3: Careerhub employee allowed file extensions for resume
column6:
Ensures that the allowed file extensions for resume uploads are properly configured in Career Hub for employees. This prevents upload errors, ensures compatibility, and supports a seamless user experience during job applications.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees may encounter errors when uploading resumes, leading to frustration and lower participation in career site activities.
column10: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)

column6:
Ensures that job bands are configured to define the role hierarchy within the organization. They are essential for determining employee eligibility and supporting internal mobility workflows.

Impact of Failure
If job bands are missing or misconfigured, employees may not be matched to the right roles, and internal mobility rules may break.
column10: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
column11: Job bands must be set up to show the role levels in your organization. They help determine which employees qualify for which roles and enable internal job movement. Without proper job bands, employees won't be matched to the right positions and career navigation will not work as expected.

column6:
Ensures that hiring band equivalencies are defined to logically group job bands across levels. This supports accurate eligibility checks and enables employees to apply for roles outside their exact job band when appropriate.

Impact of Failure
Without equivalencies, eligibility rules may be applied inconsistently, limiting internal mobility and reducing confidence in recommendations.
column10: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
column12: Adding Navigation might help too: Talent Management > Internal Mobility

column6:
Ensures that the hiring band filter is enabled on the employee home page. This filter shows employees only the jobs they are eligible for based on their band, improving the quality of recommendations.

Impact of Failure
If this filter is disabled (default is 0), employees may see jobs they are not eligible for, which can lead to confusion, lower engagement, and poor overall experience in the Career Hub.
column10: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
column12: Add the config where key is found:  Talent Management > Internal Mobiligy > hiring_band_filtering

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have their associated levels defined in Internal mobility config
column6:
Validates whether employee levels are defined in the internal mobility configuration. This setup is essential to determine the employee hierarchy and ensure correct eligibility, matching, and mobility features.

Impact of Failure
Missing level mappings in the configuration can disrupt job matching, seniority inference, and internal mobility workflows.
column10: Internal Mobility (One-Click Apply or redirect to ATS for employees)
column11:
Validates whether employee levels are defined in the internal mobility configuration. This setup is essential to determine the employee mobility hierarchy and ensure correct eligibility, matching, and mobility features.

Impact of Failure
Missing level mappings in the configuration can disrupt job matching, seniority inference, and internal mobility workflows.
column12: The rule employee_level_quality checks for absence of employee.level while the rule employee_levels_in_internal_mobility_config_quality checks for both absence and invalid levels. Potentially, we could eliminate the employee_level_quality rule.

column6:
Checks if the "User Name" type navigation link is configured for the mobile app to enable user navigation in the app interface.

Impact of Failure
If missing, users may not have appropriate navigation in the mobile app.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager email
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a manager email defined, which is essential for building accurate org charts and enabling manager-based data permissions in Talent Management workflows.

Impact of Failure
Missing manager emails disrupt org chart generation, reduce reporting accuracy, and limit manager-based workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager_id
column6:
Checks whether most employees have a manager_userid defined, which is critical for generating accurate org charts and enabling manager-based workflows in Talent Management.

Impact of Failure
Missing manager_userid prevents the system from constructing org charts and disrupts manager-based reporting and workflows.

Ensures projects are integrated into Global Search so employees can search for project opportunities using platform-wide filters.

Impact of Failure
Without this, employees may be unable to find relevant projects, reducing participation in project-based development.

Ensures the "Projects Explore" feature is configured, allowing employees to browse and discover projects aligned with their interests and skills.

Impact of Failure
If not enabled, employees may struggle to find suitable project opportunities.

Checks whether the "Recommended Projects" feed is configured in the order of feeds, ensuring employees see project recommendations on their Career Hub home page.

Impact of Failure
Without this feed, employees may miss project opportunities relevant to their development goals.

column3: Upskilling tab exists under own profile page
column6:
Checks whether the Upskilling tab is configured under the employee's profile page for organization-led upskilling workflows in Career Hub.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, employees will not see the Upskilling tab, limiting access to org-led upskilling plans.
column12: repurpose this as a check for that the template management option is available to the HRBP/Talent admin?

column6:
Checks whether the Upskilling link is present in the top navigation bar in Career Hub to allow easy access to upskilling opportunities.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees will not see the Upskilling link in the top navigation, reducing discoverability and usage of upskilling features.
column11:
Checks whether the Upskilling link is present in the top navigation bar when org led upskilling is enabled in Career Hub to allow easy access to upskilling opportunities.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, employees will not see the Upskilling link in the top navigation, reducing discoverability and usage of upskilling features.
column12: This is only relevant when using org led upskilling

column6:
Ensures the position filter query (fq) is configured for Smart Apply in Career Site and Referrals, allowing proper filtering of positions during referral and application workflows.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, referrals and applications may surface irrelevant positions, reducing the effectiveness of Smart Referrals.

Checks whether the "My Referrals" section is present in the Career Hub navigation bar, allowing employees to view and manage their referrals easily.

Impact of Failure
Without this section, employees may be unable to track their referral activities, reducing participation in referral programs.

Ensures the "My Referrals" configuration is present within Career Hub, enabling employees to access and manage their referrals effectively.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, employees will not have visibility into their referrals, limiting engagement in referral workflows.

Checks whether employees are assigned to roles in Talent Design, which is necessary for identifying required skills and aligning them with succession planning and development workflows.

Impact of Failure
Without role assignments, the system cannot determine required skills for employees, reducing the accuracy of planning and upskilling workflows.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have at least 3 skills
column6:
Checks whether most roles have at least 3 skills defined, ensuring role requirements are captured accurately for succession planning and recommendations in Talent Management workflows.

Impact of Failure
Roles with fewer than 3 skills will reduce the quality of recommendations and benchmarking across succession planning workflows.

Checks that users with HRBP (Human Resources Business Partner) permissions are created to access HRBP features within the system.

Impact of Failure
Without HRBP user assignments, HRBP-specific features will not be accessible to the intended users, limiting HR's ability to manage and oversee talent processes.

Ensures the 'Position Only Succession Plan' configuration is enabled within Succession Planning, which restricts planning to position-based succession workflows.

Impact of Failure
Without this configuration, the system will not enforce position-only planning, which may cause misalignment with organizational planning policies.

Checks whether employees are assigned to roles in Talent Design, necessary for identifying required skills and aligning employees with succession and development plans.

Impact of Failure
Without accurate role assignments, the system cannot infer required skills for employees, impacting succession planning and development workflows.

Checks whether users with HRBP (Human Resources Business Partner) permissions have been created to access HRBP features in the system.

Impact of Failure
Without HRBP user assignments, HRBP-specific features will be inaccessible, limiting HR's ability to support talent processes effectively.

Ensures the "Talent Hub" configuration is present, allowing HRBPs to access the Talent Hub view for managing team planning and succession workflows.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, HRBPs will be unable to use Talent Hub features for talent management.

Ensures the "Talent Hub" tab order is configured to display team planning tabs correctly within the HRBP Talent Hub view.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, the Talent Hub may display tabs in an incorrect or confusing order for HRBPs.

Ensures the team planning table columns are displayed in the correct order within the Talent Hub view for HRBPs.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, HRBPs may find the team planning table confusing or misaligned with workflow needs.

Ensures the team table column configuration is aligned with the defined column order in the Talent Hub for HRBPs.

Impact of Failure
If misaligned, the team table may display incorrect columns or cause confusion for HRBPs managing talent planning.

Ensures the profile search data fields are configured correctly for the HRBP Talent Hub view, aligning with the team table configuration for effective profile search.

Impact of Failure
Incorrect configuration may lead to incomplete or inaccurate search results within the Talent Hub.

Ensures the filter order within the Talent Hub is configured correctly for HRBPs, supporting effective filtering during team planning and succession workflows.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, filters may appear in an illogical order, reducing usability for HRBPs.

Ensures the search filters within the Talent Hub are configured correctly to support effective filtering by HRBPs during talent planning workflows.

Impact of Failure
If not configured, HRBPs may experience missing or incorrect filters, making it difficult to search and analyze employee data.

Ensures that most employee profiles have the business unit (BU) field populated to support accurate organization structure and reporting.

Impact of Failure
If missing, it may affect reporting, filtering, and visibility within the Talent Hub.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have lob (Line of Business)
column6:
Ensures that most employee profiles have the division (Line of Business, LOB) field populated to support role initialization and business function inference.

Impact of Failure
Missing LOB can impact role matching, filtering, and reporting within the Talent Hub.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have location
column6:
Ensures that most employee profiles have a location defined to support filtering and reporting in Talent Hub and other modules.

Impact of Failure
Missing location data can limit reporting capabilities and reduce the effectiveness of location-based analysis.

column3: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have level
column6:
Ensures that most employee profiles have a level defined to support seniority inference, role initialization, and recommendations within Talent Hub and related workflows.

Impact of Failure
Missing level data can affect role matching, seniority determination, and recommendations within the system.

column4: email_config is missing or null. Go to  integrations/email_config and verify the configuration exists and is saved.
column5: Ensures 'reply_to_domain' and 'send_from_domain' are complete and valid
column11: instead of checking if the email_config has object or not, we should check for 'reply_to_domain' and 'send_from_domain'

column2: The user has permission to send messages but does not have a communication email set
column5: The rule checks for users with send email permission who do not have a communication email set
column10: This function ensures that all users with the PERM_SEND_MESSAGES role permission are properly configured to send communications. It validates that each user has a designated communication email, verifies that the address is authorized for use, and flags any users who lack the appropriate configuration.

column4: SMS integration not configured. Go to  integrations/email_config and verify SMS provider and credentials.
column5:
Ensures that SMS integration is enabled with valid provider configuration (Twilio, etc.). SMS provider credentials and phone number must be configured.

Impact of Failure
SMS messages cannot be sent without provider configuration.

[Purpose] Verifies that communication channels (sms, whatsapp) are configured for interview scheduling to ensure smooth communication between interviewers and candidates.
[Impact] Missing configurations for communication channels can disrupt scheduling, reducing interview efficiency.
column11: Rule needs to take into account customers that have NOT enabled other communication channels (SMS or Whatsapp).
column12: Phase 1 - feature alignment Phase 2 - rule logic update

column4: WhatsApp integration not configured. Go to integrations/email_config and verify WhatsApp Business API configuration.
column5:
Ensures that WhatsApp Business API integration is configured with provider credentials and phone number.

Impact of Failure
WhatsApp messages cannot be sent without provider configuration.

column2: All job req templates should be present in template_to_stage_transition_map
column5: This rule ensures that all job req template IDs for this instance are present in template_to_stage_transition_map of ATS config

[Purpose] This rule verifies the presence of the Leads Workflow tab in the pipeline page.
[Impact] The Leads Workflow tab on the pipeline page is the initial touchpoint for recruiters as they begin filling positions. Ensuring this tab is available and properly configured is essential for a smooth recruitment process and recruiter productivity.

[Purpose] Configures the rendering of different tabs (workflows) on the position pipeline. Defines how to configure tab visibility, columns, filters, actions and behaviour for recruiters and hiring managers. [Impact] Missing or incorrect tab configuration can prevent users from accessing relevant workflows, disrupting applicant workflow management
column10: [Purpose] This rule verifies the presence of the Applicant Workflow tab on the pipeline page. [Impact] The Applicant Workflow tab lists all candidates who have applied or are under consideration for a job requisition. It serves as a central workspace to reviewing and advancing applicants efficiently, ensuring a streamlined recruitment process.
column11: With this rule, would it be possible to run a report on against the current configuration to identify the base requirements (ie Contacted, Applicants flows are missing)

column2: Successful Application Stage Advances Per Job Req Template
column5: Every job req template should have atleast a 90% success rate with stage advances
column10: Every job requisition template must achieve at least a 90% success rate when advancing stages from Eightfold to the external system. If the stage transition map is configured correctly, stage advances should not fail.

column4: Profile sections not configured. Go to integrations/profile_display_config and ensure at least these sections are enabled.
column5:
Ensures that key profile sections are defined and enabled. At minimum, overview section should be present.

Impact of Failure
Profile information cannot be displayed to recruiters without section configuration.

column4: Copilot capabilities not configured. Go to integrations/copilot_capability_config and enable at least one capability.
column5:
Ensures that specific Copilot capabilities (job description generation, scheduling assistance, etc.) are enabled in capability configuration.

Impact of Failure
Copilot will be enabled but have no usable features.

column4: Copilot not enabled. Go to integrations/copilot_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that Copilot feature is enabled in configuration. Copilot must be explicitly enabled before use.

Impact of Failure
Copilot features will not be accessible to users.

column4: Diversity configuration missing. Go to integrations/diversity_config and initialize the configuration.
column5:
Ensures that diversity configuration object exists. This config controls bias reduction features like profile masking.

Impact of Failure
Diversity and bias reduction features cannot function without configuration.

column4: Masking fields not configured. Go to integrations/diversity_config and specify which fields to mask.
column5:
Ensures that if profile masking is enabled, specific fields are configured to be masked (age, gender, ethnicity, etc.).

Impact of Failure
Masking feature will be enabled but no fields will actually be masked, defeating the purpose.

column4: Anonymization rules should be configured based on defined criteria.
column5:
Ensures that anonymization rules are correctly configured to automatically anonymize candidate profiles based on defined criteria (e.g., event end date, inactivity period, talent network opt-out).

Impact of Failure
Candidate data may not be anonymized according to compliance requirements, creating data privacy and regulatory risks.

column4: Event recruiting not enabled. Go to integrations/planned_event_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that event recruiting feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation and management of recruiting events.

Impact of Failure
Event recruiting features are not accessible.

column4: Event stages not configured. Go to integrations/planned_event_workflow_config and define event stages.
column5:
Ensures that event-specific pipeline stages are configured, defining how candidates progress through event recruiting.

Impact of Failure
Candidates in events cannot be moved through stages without configuration.

column4: Event home configuration invalid. Go to integrations/planned_event_home_config and configure display settings.
column5:
Ensures that event home configuration is set up, controlling how events are displayed and listed in the UI.

Impact of Failure
Events list may not display correctly to recruiters.

column4: Assessment error messages should be captured properly.
column5:
Ensures that when assessment requests fail and candidates are moved to Assessment Error stage, the error message is captured in the candidate's external_custom_info and displayed in the Assessment Error view.

Impact of Failure
Recruiters cannot see why assessment requests failed, making it difficult to troubleshoot and retry assessments, leading to candidate pipeline delays.

column4: Assessment triggers should be configured with all required fields.
column5:
Ensures that event assessment triggers are configured to pass all required fields to external assessment systems, including action_user_email, regardless of whether triggered from event pipeline or position pipeline.

Impact of Failure
Assessment triggers may fail or send incomplete data to third-party systems, preventing proper tracking of who initiated assessments and breaking downstream reporting.

column4: Global search not enabled. Go to integrations/global_search_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that global search feature is enabled in configuration, allowing recruiters to search across the talent network.

Impact of Failure
Recruiters cannot search for candidates without global search enabled.

column4: Search filters not configured. Go to integrations/global_search_config and configure filters.
column5:
Ensures that search filters are configured, allowing recruiters to refine searches by location, skills, experience, etc.

Impact of Failure
Search results cannot be filtered effectively without filter configuration.
column10:
Ensures that search filters are configured, allowing recruiters to refine searches by location, skills, experience, contact_consent etc.

Impact of Failure
Search results cannot be filtered effectively without filter configuration.
column11: This should be kept added contact_consent to description.

column5:
[Purpose] Defines the columns, display names, fields, formatting, and widths for the consolidated feedback report. This ensures the report is well-structured, visually clear, and easily interpretable by recruiters, hiring managers, and other stakeholders.
[Impact] Properly configured columns and formatting improve the usability and professionalism of the feedback report, enabling better hiring decisions and streamlined evaluation processes.

[Purpose] Configures the list of columns displayed on the feedback dashboard to provide relevant and actionable information to users. Each column represents a key attribute related to the feedback process, ensuring clarity and usability of the dashboard.
[Impact] Missing or improperly configured columns can result in incomplete or irrelevant data being displayed, reducing the dashboard's effectiveness and user efficiency.

column4: Feedback forms not configured. Go to integrations/interview_feedback_config and create at least one feedback form template.
column5:
Ensures that feedback form templates are configured. Forms define the structure and questions for interview feedback.

Impact of Failure
Interviewers cannot submit feedback without form templates.

column4: Interview feedback not configured. Go to integrations/interview_feedback_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that interview feedback feature is configured and enabled, allowing interviewers to submit structured feedback.

Impact of Failure
Interview feedback cannot be collected without configuration.

column4: Smart campaigns not enabled. Go to integrations/campaign_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that smart campaigns feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation of candidate nurture campaigns.

Impact of Failure
Campaign features are not accessible to users.

column4: Campaign templates not found. Go to integrations/email_templates and create templates for campaign use.
column5:
Ensures that email templates specific to campaigns are configured for candidate outreach.

Impact of Failure
Campaigns cannot send emails without templates.
column11: System should check for at least 1 associated campaign template is configured in the system

column5:
[Purpose] Ensures a default interview timezone is configured for scenarios where user-defined or calendar-specific timezones are unavailable. This avoids scheduling errors and confusion caused by timezone mismatches.
[Impact] Missing timezone configuration can lead to scheduling inaccuracies, affecting candidate and interviewer availability.

[Purpose] Ensures the scheduling action is enabled on the profile or pipeline page, allowing recruiters to initiate interview scheduling directly.
[Impact] If not enabled, recruiters cannot initiate the scheduling process, leading to delays and inefficiencies in interview coordination.

column4: Calendar integration not configured. Go to integrations/scheduling_config and configure calendar provider.
column5:
Ensures that calendar integration is configured with provider credentials. Integration is required for checking availability and creating calendar events.

Impact of Failure
System cannot create calendar events or check interviewer availability.
column11: Calendar integration doesnt require any specific setup with regards to Provider credentials. Global Rules should include checks on Branding Config, Company Name, Calendar Provider, Availability, Preferences

column4: Scheduling center filters should have appropriate facet limits.
column5:
Ensures that filters in the Scheduling Center (hiring manager, location, etc.) have appropriate facet limits and autocomplete configurations to display all relevant options.

Impact of Failure
Users may only see a limited subset of hiring managers or locations in filters, making it difficult to find and schedule interviews for all positions.
column11: For this functionality, EF has default configuration that most customers are happy with

column4: Scheduling templates not found. Go to integrations/scheduling_config and create at least one template.
column5:
Ensures that scheduling templates are configured, defining interview types, durations, and participant roles.

Impact of Failure
Interviews cannot be scheduled without templates defining the structure.

column4: Template permissions should be correctly configured.
column5:
Ensures that role permissions for scheduling templates are correctly configured. Users with 'perm_admin_email_scheduling_templates' should be able to view, edit, and manage all scheduling templates.

Impact of Failure
Users may not be able to edit templates even when they have the correct permission, blocking scheduling workflow setup and management.

column4: Scheduling configuration not enabled. Go to integrations/scheduling_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that smart scheduling feature is configured and enabled, allowing automated interview scheduling.

Impact of Failure
Interview scheduling features cannot be used without configuration.

[Purpose] Ensures a calendar provider (e.g., Google Calendar, Microsoft Outlook 365) is configured to enable seamless interview scheduling and synchronization with interviewers' and candidates' calendars.
[Impact] Without a configured calendar provider, the system cannot synchronize interviews, requiring manual scheduling and leading to inefficiencies.

column4: Talent communities not enabled. Go to integrations/community_home_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that talent communities feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation and management of talent pools.

Impact of Failure
Talent communities features are not accessible.

column4: Community stages not configured. Go to integrations/community_workflow_config and define stages.
column5:
Ensures that community pipeline stages are configured, defining how candidates progress within talent communities.

Impact of Failure
Community members cannot be managed through stages.

[Purpose] This rule verifies that the Community Home page is correctly configured by ensuring the presence and validity of the key objects, available_filters, filter_to_fq_data_map, and columns in community_home_config. [Impact] These configurations ensure the Community Home page functions as a unified dashboard for recruiters to manage and analyze all talent communities. Missing components can render the feature non-functional or significantly impair talent sourcing.
column10: [Purpose] This rule verifies that the Community Home page is correctly configured by ensuring the presence and validity of the key objects, available_filters, filter_to_fq_data_map, and columns in community_home_config. [Impact] These configurations ensure the Community Home page functions as a unified dashboard for recruiters to manage and analyze all talent communities. Missing components can render the feature non-functional or significantly impair talent sourcing.
column11: Currently, the rule only checks if the available_filters is not empty or null. But it should also check for filter_to_fq_data_map and columns

column5: [Purpose] Configures the rendering of different tabs (workflows) on the community prospects page for various community types. Defines how to configure tab visibility and behavior based on the specific community type being accessed. [Impact] Missing or incorrect tab configuration can prevent users from accessing relevant workflows, disrupting prospect management.
column10: [Purpose] Verifies that community_workflow_config is defined per community type with a valid display_name and non-empty workflow steps. [Impact] Ensures Community pipelines render and function correctly, stages appear in the UI, community types display consistently, and stage progressions/automations work. Without this, communities can't progress prospects or reflect status, breaking sourcing workflows.

column4: Workflow automation not enabled. Go to integrations/workflow_automation_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that workflow automation feature is configured and enabled, allowing creation of automated candidate workflows.

Impact of Failure
Workflow automation features are not available to users.

column4: Workflow triggers not configured. Go to workflows and configure triggers with valid events.
column5:
Ensures that at least one workflow trigger is configured. Triggers define when workflows execute (stage change, application, etc.).

Impact of Failure
Workflows cannot execute without trigger configuration.
This rule evaluates the health of position sync for the group_id. Position sync lag must be lower than 60 minutes for the last 7 days for this rule to pass.

column2: Successful Application Submissions Per Job Req Template
column5: There should be atleast 3 successful application submissions for each job req template in the last week

[Purpose] Configures a clear and actionable message displayed when the Communities feature is disabled, ensuring users understand why it is unavailable and what steps they can take.
[Impact] Without this configuration, users may be confused about the feature's unavailability, leading to frustration or support tickets.

[Purpose]: Ensures that reminders set by users on a candidate's profile are visible across all platforms, including the EF extension, to prevent duplicate outreach or conflicting engagements. This feature enables team-wide collaboration and reduces redundant communication.
[Impact] Without this configuration, team members may unknowingly duplicate efforts, resulting in poor candidate experience and inefficient use of sourcing resources.

[Purpose] Ensures that the hostname is set in the app_configs section of extension config for linkedin, naukri and github.
[Impact] Missing hostname configuration can prevent proper interaction with specific websites, impacting functionality such as profile parsing and candidate engagement.

[Purpose] Ensures that all actions and sub-actions are properly configured, providing recruiters and sourcers with streamlined functionality for managing candidates. Actions include saving candidates, marking statuses, setting reminders, and performing other key operations within the platform and extensions.
[Impact] Missing or incorrectly configured actions may hinder efficient candidate management, resulting in workflow inefficiencies and reduced collaboration.
column10: Ensures that all actions and sub-actions are correctly set up so recruiters and sourcers have a smooth, intuitive experience managing candidates. These actions include saving candidates, updating statuses, setting reminders, and performing other key functions within the platform and browser extensions. [Impact] If actions are missing or misconfigured, recruiters may be unable to manage candidates efficiently, leading to workflow delays, errors, and reduced team collaboration.

column4: PCS base configuration not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config and set enabled: true.
column5: Ensures that PCS base configuration is present and enabled. This is the foundational config for all career site functionality. Impact of Failure: Career site will not be accessible to candidates without base configuration.

column4: Application form not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config Apply Form and configure fields.
column5: Ensures that application form configuration exists, defining which fields candidates must complete and the application workflow. Impact of Failure: Candidates cannot apply to positions without form configuration.

column4: Company logo missing. Go to integrations/branding_config and upload company logo.
column5: Ensures that company logo is uploaded and configured. Logo URL must be a valid URL format and not empty or placeholder. Impact of Failure: Career site will display without company logo, impacting brand recognition.

column4: Brand colors not configured. Go to integrations/branding_config and configure primary and secondary colors.
column5: Ensures that brand colors are configured with valid hex color codes (e.g., #146da6). Empty or invalid color codes will cause styling issues. Impact of Failure: Career site will use default colors instead of brand colors.

column4: Mobile configurations should be correctly defined using device_configuration settings.
column5: Ensures that mobile-specific configurations like hero images, banners, and layouts are correctly defined using device_configuration settings and display properly on mobile devices. Impact of Failure: Mobile users may see blank spaces instead of images, broken layouts, or desktop-sized content that doesn't fit mobile screens.

column4: Login/signup not configured. Go to integrations/login_signup_config and configure authentication method.
column5: Ensures that login and signup configuration is valid, defining how candidates create accounts and authenticate. Impact of Failure: Candidates cannot create accounts or log in without proper configuration.

column4: Profile fields not configured. Go to integrations/candidate_profile_config and define profile fields.
column5: Ensures that profile fields are defined, specifying what information candidates can display in their profiles. Impact of Failure: Candidates will be unable to maintain a living profile with their latest skills, experience, education, etc., thereby impacting the quality of matching job recommendations.

column4: Candidate copilot not enabled. Go to integrations/chatbotx_config and set enabled: true for candidate copilot.
column5: Ensures that candidate-facing copilot (chatbot) is configured and enabled, providing AI assistance to candidates. Impact of Failure: Candidate copilot features will not be available on career site.

column4: Custom domain not configured. Go to integrations/domain_whitelabeling_config and configure custom domain.
column5:
Ensures that custom domain is configured with valid domain name format. DNS settings should be verified for proper routing.

Impact of Failure
Career site will use default Eightfold domain instead of company's branded domain.

column4: SSL certificate issue detected. Go to integrations/domain_whitelabeling_config and verify SSL certificate.
column5:
Ensures that SSL certificate is present and valid for secure HTTPS access to career site.

Impact of Failure
Career site will show security warnings or be inaccessible via HTTPS.

column4: Job alerts not enabled. Go to integrations/notification_config and enable job alerts.
column5:
Ensures that job alerts are configured and enabled in notification settings, allowing candidates to receive personalized job recommendations.

Impact of Failure
Candidates will not receive job alert emails.

column4: Alert frequency not configured. Go to integrations/candidate_notifications_config and configure frequency options.
column5:
Ensures that job alert frequency settings are configured, allowing candidates to choose how often they receive alerts.

Impact of Failure
Job alerts may send too frequently or not at all without frequency configuration.

column4: Job feed not enabled. Go to integrations/job_feed_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that job feed configuration is enabled, allowing generation of XML feeds for job board distribution and SEO.

Impact of Failure
Jobs will not be distributed to job boards or search engines.

column4: SEO not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config SEO and configure meta tags and structured data.
column5:
Ensures that SEO configuration is valid, including meta tags, structured data markup, and sitemap settings for search engine optimization.

Impact of Failure
Career site will have poor search engine visibility and rankings.

column4: Search not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config Search and configure search settings.
column5:
Ensures that search configuration is enabled, allowing candidates to search and filter jobs on career site.

Impact of Failure
Candidates cannot search for jobs effectively without search configuration.

column4: Search filters missing. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config Search and configure filters.
column5:
Ensures that job search filters are configured, allowing candidates to refine search results by various criteria.

Impact of Failure
Candidates can search but cannot filter results, leading to poor user experience.

column4: Talent network join not enabled. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and enable talent network join option.
column5:
Ensures that talent network join feature is enabled in smart apply configuration, allowing candidates to join without applying to specific positions.

Impact of Failure
Candidates cannot join talent network, limiting talent pool growth.

column4: Join form not configured. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and configure talent network form.
column5:
Ensures that talent network join form is configured, defining what information candidates provide when joining.

Impact of Failure
Join form may be incomplete or fail to capture necessary candidate information.

column4: Landing pages not configured. Go to integrations/landing_config and initialize configuration.
column5:
Ensures that landing page configuration is enabled, allowing upload and hosting of custom landing pages.

Impact of Failure
Custom landing pages cannot be created or accessed.

column4: Landing page URLs invalid. Go to integrations/landing_config and verify URL paths.
column5:
Ensures that landing pages have valid URLs configured and are accessible. URLs should follow proper format and routing.

Impact of Failure
Landing pages will be inaccessible via their intended URLs.

column4: Microsite configuration incomplete. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config Microsites and verify configuration.
column5:
Ensures that each microsite has complete configuration including branding, domain mapping, and job filters.

Impact of Failure
Microsites will not display correctly or show wrong job listings.

column4: Microsite isolation should be configured properly.
column5:
Ensures that candidate login sessions, profiles, and applications are isolated between parent career site and microsites. Candidates should have separate accounts and application histories per microsite.

Impact of Failure
Candidates see applications from other microsites, branding bleeds across sites, and logout redirects to wrong site, creating confusion and poor experience.

column2: People You May Work With Enabled
column4: People You May Work With not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config position_details_config sections_config and enable pymww_config section.
column5: People You May Work With not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config position_details_config sections_config and enable pymww_config section.

column4: Selection criteria missing. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config position_details_config sections_config pymww_config and add the fq.
column5: People You May Work With not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config position_details_config sections_config pymww_config and add the fq for PYMWW results.

column4: Tracking scripts invalid. Go to integrations/tracking_pixel_config and verify JavaScript syntax.
column5:
Ensures that tracking scripts have valid JavaScript syntax and are configured to trigger on appropriate events (page load, application, etc.).

Impact of Failure
Tracking will fail or not trigger, causing data gaps in analytics.

column2: PCS and TA Match Score Consistency
column4: Match scores should be consistent between PCS and TA.
column5:
Ensures that match scores displayed to candidates on PCS match the scores shown to recruiters in TA for the same candidate-job combination, preventing confusion and maintaining transparency.

Impact of Failure
Candidates see different match ratings on PCS than recruiters see in TA (e.g., 4.5 stars vs 'good match'), creating mistrust and inconsistent candidate experience.

column4: Linkoff config is not enabled. Go to Integrations pcsx_base_config apply_form_config link_off_apply_config and set enabled to true
column5:
Ensures that Linkoff is configured and enabled

Impact of Failure
Applications will be routed to smart apply flow

column4: Linkoff config is enabled but redirect url is not added. Go to Integrations pcsx_base_config apply_form_config link_off_apply_config and add apply_redirect_url
column5:
Ensures that Linkoff is enabled and configured to route to proper application link

Impact of Failure
Applications will be routed to smart apply flow

column4: Smart Apply not enabled. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that Smart Apply is configured and enabled with proper ATS integration settings for application sync.

Impact of Failure
Applications will not sync to ATS, breaking the recruiting workflow.

column4: Field mapping incomplete. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config Field Mapping and map all required fields.
column5:
Ensures that field mappings are complete, defining how candidate data maps from Eightfold to ATS fields.

Impact of Failure
Application data will be incomplete or fail to sync to ATS.

column4: Smart referrals not enabled. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config and enable referrals functionality.
column5:
Ensures that smart referral feature is configured and enabled, allowing employees to refer candidates with AI matching.

Impact of Failure
Employee referral functionality will not be available.

column4: Referral workflow not configured. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config Referrals and configure workflow.
column5:
Ensures that referral workflow is configured, defining how referrals are submitted, tracked, and potentially rewarded.

Impact of Failure
Referral process will be incomplete or confusing for employees.

column4: Source parameters not configured. Go to integrations/source_map_config and configure source tracking.
column5:
Ensures that source tracking parameters are configured, defining how different sources are identified and tracked (UTM params, referral codes, etc.).

Impact of Failure
Sources will not be captured correctly, leading to inaccurate attribution.

column4: Source tracking not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config Source Tracking and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that source tracking is configured and enabled, capturing where candidates come from before applying.

Impact of Failure
Cannot track recruitment marketing effectiveness or candidate sources.

column4: Source sync not configured. Go to integrations/smart_apply_config Source Mapping and configure source field mapping.
column5:
Ensures that source tracking data is mapped to sync with applications to the ATS, maintaining source attribution.

Impact of Failure
Source tracking data will be lost when applications sync to ATS.

column4: Withdraw functionality not enabled. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config Applications and enable withdraw application option.
column5:
Ensures that withdraw application feature is enabled, allowing candidates to withdraw their applications.

Impact of Failure
Candidates cannot withdraw applications, leading to poor candidate experience.

column4: Withdraw workflow not configured. Go to integrations/pcsx_base_config Applications Withdraw and configure workflow.
column5:
Ensures that withdraw workflow is properly configured, including confirmation dialog, ATS sync, and candidate notification.

Impact of Failure
Withdrawals may not sync to ATS or candidates may withdraw accidentally without confirmation.

This rule ensures the star_threshold is configured to define the minimum criteria for matching candidates to job roles. This prevents irrelevant or poorly matched candidates from being displayed as potential applicants.

Impact of Failure
Without configuring this threshold, the system may surface irrelevant matches, leading to poor candidate and recruiter experiences.
column10: [Purpose] This rule ensures that pcx_base_config search_config strong_match_threshold is configured to define the minimum criteria for matching candidates to job roles. This prevents irrelevant or poorly matched candidates from being displayed as potential applicants. (Talent Experience PCS IX) [Impact] Without configuring this threshold, the system may surface irrelevant matches, leading to poor candidate and recruiter experiences.

column4: Candidate profile not enabled. Go to integrations/candidate_profile_config and set enabled: true.
column5:
Ensures that candidate profile configuration is enabled, allowing candidates to create and manage their profiles.

Impact of Failure
Candidates cannot create profiles or save information for future applications.
